ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: One hour during most weeks, four hours when we had an exam.
3, about 18 hrs on midterm
4 except when midterm was due, then 10-12 that week.
2 hours
2 hrs
5-6 hours
For labs, 1-2 hours/wk outside of class. More (~10) for the midterm and final.
1 hour/wk for the labs.5 hrs/week for the exams.
1 hour
during a regular week, around 3 hours. however, for a midterm or final... much much more.
5 hrs per week
10 hours
Probably about two hours a week (one hour in lab, another hour outside lab) on the homework, maybe 6 hours on the midterm and final?
I spent about 2 hours weekly doing the lab assignments. However, I spent much more time, about 24 to 72 hours doing the midterm, and close to 96 hours doing the final exams
1-2 per week, 10-12 hours on exams
FOREVER on the midterm and final
The midterm and finals take forever
Approximately 3 hours/week
About 8-10 hours per week
1 hour, plus more for the take home exams
2-3, 8-10 for the midterm and 10-15 for the final
This class required six to seven hours per week for me. I found it to be quite challenging, however, so other students might have spent less time.
12-15 hours
8 hours
4 hrs/week
12 hrs
5-6 hrs/wk

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: On midterm, one little mistake resulted in relatively high point substraction
strengths - great crash course in data management and analysis through SAS, very practical

Supposedly useful for internships, but as I will be using SPSS on my internship, pretty pointless. Lectures were extremely long, conflicted with all other classes I wanted to take, and I certainly would not have taken it if I was not required to.
Very good SAS class.

Great course! I feel very confident about handling data now. Although i recognize the importance of cleaning and preparing data, I only wish we had gone through that part of the course faster so we could spend more time on analysis.
Strengths: the course is necessaryWeaknesses: the course is difficult to understand
this was a very challenging course but overall i learned a lot about sas that will be useful!
Tough but totally necessary.

strengths: it started from the very beginning of SAS. This is good for students who need a dummy-proof introduction to the software.weakness: The class should meet twice a week so the lecture wouldn't be so dense.

Absolutely crucial in order to learn programming and writing SAS code. The added benefit was that we were shown how SAS output translates into table shells and typical write ups. He explained a lot of the theory behind many of the statistical tests we use, as well as giving us concise instructions as to how to interpret the results.
You will learn SAS by hook or by crook.
Excellent.
Very clear! Very practical. Lab was very helpful
Great approach to SAS and between lectures and labs you really learn how to apply it.weaknesses: none.
very, very useful

This course is excellent. Mayur is a great teacher and I wouldn't change the course. The only potential change that I suggest is to to separate the course into a 2*week lecture since 2 hours in a row of SAS can be a bit much especially at the end of the day.

Data Management is a useful course for gaining experience with SAS. The labs are very helpful. I found it difficult to learn, however, from the lectures. The lecture notes provided useful reference materials, but it is hard to absorb information on programming methods during a 2 hour lecture.

Lectures are very clear and well organized. Labs were extremely helpful. This class taught me the logic behind SAS. Now I feel like I know how to tell SAS what to do to make it do what I want, instead of having to rely on being spoon-fed the code.

I would do away with the lecture portion of the course and have two labs a week instead. That would be really, really helpful. One lab could teach us how to do the material, and the next lab we would have to program the same material on our own. We could come in before class with it done or program in class. That would help prepare everyone for the daunting tests.
great course and every student should have it
Great class, very useful
Mayur is awesome. Learn more from labs than from class. In fact, could skip class altogether.

i would have liked more time on mediational analysis. more information on full and partial mediation. also more training on analyzing moderated mediation and mediated moderation that are gaining popularity in the literature.Also sample size calculations when surveys are used.
It is a must. This class puts it all together... from how to turn the computer on up to how to choose the appropriate variables for you model!!
By far most useful class- even if the most challenging- I have taken at YSPH so far. Actually learned how to do something that might be useful in my career!
Strengths- Dr Desai is very thorough and exciting.Weakness- My TA was good, but he moved through the labs too quickly.
Overall, students develop a broad skill set related to SAS programming.

Incredibly useful course when taken before summer research/internship. Strengths include the lectures (the slides are thorough and coherent) and the professor (Desai was able to mold an inherently mundane subject into something interesting.)
Excellent. Made SAS understandable and fun.

The course is obviously a wonderful one. SAS is a great skill to learn. I really enjoyed it. I can't think of any weaknesses. Strengths: SAS is a tool which I think every MPH graduate should be able to use. The course ensures you learn what you need to know about SAS.

This was my favorite course of the entire semester. Not only did we learn core concepts about data management but we learned so much SAS. I loved it! This was precisely what I wanted biostats 1 and 2 to be, but not what happened. This class was challenging, and we covered a great deal; Prof. Desai recognized that we had covered concepts, but never did I feel what that there was overlap because his version was either (a) more through and/or (b) more detailed/more SAS/more fun. This could also be that I'm extremely math/data oriented. Especially given that my summer internship is going to require a lot of data management skills, this is truly the only class that I think will have a practical effect. This also disappoints me because I wish there were more classes like this during the first year.This course should be moved to fall semester. Biostat can fuse into one course. Dr. Desai should teach some version like Data Management II second semester where we get into it further/other programs. That would have been so useful.

The course is incredibly helpful in that it leaves the student with an overall proficiency in using SAS to perform data analysis. The course also served as an excellent complement to biostatistics by providing a second opportunity to review and employ each of the main biostatistical methods. All students are forced to work their way through the assignments and exams which really is the best way to master the material and practice self reliance.
The labs were really helpful. the lectures were just too long. it was so hard to pay attention.

The class is a necessary evil that is taught in the most amicable way possible. I learned a great deal and am much more comfortable with SAS as a result. It may not have been the most interesting class, but it is by far the most useful one I have taken this year.
This class actually teaches students how to use SAS and how to analyze and clean data. In my other two stats classes I never learned SAS to the extent that I learned it in Data Mgmt.

I liked this class a lot and found it very useful to learn SAS in a context of real data analysis. The labs were helpful and the exams forced us to really learn the material. The only real weakness I can think of was that the lecture was somewhat dry at times, but I think that is mostly because SAS and data management are somewhat difficult to talk about in an engaging manner.
This was my favorite course this semester! What I appreciated most about this course was the opportunity to build a practical skill set for data analysis.
This is a great course to learn SAS. A 2 hour weekly lecture is not necessary, the labs were enough to understand the key points. This course should be more hands-on and less lecture-based.

I very much enjoyed this class because it was very applicable. You get a little bit of exposure to SAS in the Biostatistics classes, but it was in this class that I really LEARNED SAS! I learned skills in this class that I will be using in my internship to clean and analyze data, opening the door for me to publish articles - without those skills, these opportunitites might now have been available. The one drawback to this course was the lecture time - Wednesday from 3-5 PM - this was at the end of a very long day of class and two more hours of lecture made it hard to concentrate and really absorb the new material.

This was a great course. I feel that I am far more competent with SAS than when I began. This course is really great for getting practical experience especially in preparation for the internship and further work.
The course taught me a great deal of SAS. While there was not a whole lot of "in class" time, a great deal of time was spent completing labs and exams.

This is a very dry, boring class, but it taught me how to use SAS much more thoroughly than did Biostats I and II. The midterm and final were appropriately challenging and engaging, and, dare I say it, I enjoyed them.
Great course but quite repetitive. There is an extraordinary amount of crossover with Biostats 2.
Really helpful and great class. Really difficult midterm and final - challenging but fair.
Great course for understanding how to utilize SAS in a very relevant approach. Excellent instruction and very well organized
Excellent. You really learn how to use SAS in this course.
The lectures were clearly laid out to learn the material. The topics covered were very helpful in the structure of internship data and analysis.
NOTHING. ITS A GREAT COURSE
This course is very useful for future study

Fantastic course that is taught by a great professor. The course provides students with the fundermentals of SAS and in my opinion, it should be one of the first courses students as it gives a good foundation.
Excellent and very practical course. I finally feel like I can program in SAS. The homework was very useful and the tests were fair.
excellent and challenging
Good TA, very useful class, required much more work than any other class I took this semester
One weakness is that the student must be willing to teach his or herself the material.
Not a fan of SAS, but the course was incredibly helpful.
Very important and useful class. I would recommend it to all public health students and believe it should be a requirement.
Excellent course!

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  strengths - excellent instructor, can make any subject interesting
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Good instructor, but SAS is difficult to teach in a group environment.
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Very good.

Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Professor Desai is a fantastic instructor. I'm amazed that he was able to take such dry material and make it actually interesting. His explanations and powerpoints were very intuitive and easy to understand.
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Strengths:Weaknesses: the Professor did not give adequate feedback

Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  desai went quite quickly at some points and it was originally hard to get into the swing of the course because it felt very much over my head to begin. however, but the time the midterm rolled around things were making a lot more sense and since then i have learned a lot!
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  really thorough. expects a ton from his students, but also gives you the tools to rise to the occasion.
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  excellent professor. He knows the material well and explicitly discusses what he expects from his students. Very precise and clear.

Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  He's a good instructor - very knowledgable on the topic. Doesn't seem very open to helping students outside of class. Can be quite short with people at times. Speeds through the lectures a little, but overall very good.
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Amazing

Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Dr Desai is the perfect instructor for this demanding course. He is brilliant but unassuming and empathetic to the plight of the SAS everyman and incipient epidemiologist.He really knows how to motivate the students to become SAS regulars ... and to eventually make more breakthroughs than breakdowns in SAS.Dr Desai motivates us because he earns our respect through:(1) his meticulous preparations(2) his spirited, lucid, and engaging presentations (tremendous variety of relevant, public health examples of using SAS in epi detective work, including some of his own accomplished investigations at the CDC)(3) his unmatched dedication to helping students who come asking questions (yours truly included) and always treating them with cordiality, dignity, and scholarly precisionWith his luminous mind and smile, and with his proven record of moving in and out of so many important epi research areas so adeptly ... Desai is a daily inspiration ... a virtual Renaissance man ... and, perhaps most importantly, a tremendous teacher who is a singularly glue-it-all-together figure for many of his students, past and present -- including practicing physicians, nurses, psychiatrists, leaders in the field of infectious-disease research, and pharmaceuticals.Long live, Dr Desai!
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Again, clarity. Felt like I could track and apply to my research.
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Great presenter and tried to bring humor to an otherwise dull subject.
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Amazing and unbelievably helpful and nice
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Mayur is a fabulous teacher. Enough said.

Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Dr. Desai is a good lecturer, and most students really like him. Personally I didn't find that our styles were well matched and I found it difficult to concentrate in his lectures. I found the TAs more useful for explaining concepts.
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Strengths- organized, clear, funny
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  great instructor and did great job
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  He is excellent
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  HE ROCKS-- he is lively and invested, and makes really boring SAS stuff actually kind of neat.
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  explains well.
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Excellent... it's Mayur...
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Ecxellent professor and mentor!

Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Desai did a great job overall. His lectures were engaging and extremely clear and thorough. The only negative is the length: one 2-hour class is rather long for SAS coding.
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  It doesn't get any better than Dr. Desai.
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Dr Desai knows his stuff

Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Prof. Desai is the best! He really knows his stuff (I know all professors do, but he is able to make us think about the answers for ourselves). He has higher expectations of us I feel like compare to other courses this semester. I really enjoyed learning SAS. I wish were had more programming classes/talked about other ways/programs though.

Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Dr. Desai is an excellent instructor. He did a wonderful job of laying out the material expected to be mastered by the students and he also provided a variety of additional reference materials within lecture packets for students to use down the road as they work on their own projects. He is a very fair grader in my opinion and very willing to respond to students questions in a timely manner.
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Extremely fair and an extremely good teacher. SAS is actually understandable after taking this course.
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  He was great, i appreciated his humor.

Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Dr. Desai is the best person to teach Data Management, because he is the only person who can make the material interesting and entertaining. His explanations were very clear, and I think I will bring his lecture slides with me to graduate school because they are so useful.
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Dr. Desai is an excellent professor and does a really great job of presenting the material to students.
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Dr. Desai was very knowledgeable and organized. I appreciated his sense of humor during lecture.

Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  The instructor was excellent! What I appreciated most about the instructor were his extensive examples, step-by-step instructions, and organized notes. The instructor did a great job in facilitating a solid foundation for data management and analysis in SAS as well as an understanding of statistical methods.
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  He was great instructor.

Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Dr. Desai is an excellent instructor. He explains SAS is such an easy-to-understand way. The assignments he gives us (the labs, midterm and final) are applicable in real life and give you the skills necessary to work with data during internships and your own research. He is very knowledgeable about SAS and he answers questions and explains the concepts very well.

Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  THe instructor was excellent. The subject is definitely not entertaining, but he certainly tried to make it that way. His slides are very informative and I plan on referencing them well after the class is over. He presented the material very well and is easy to understand.
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Very logical and straightforward.
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Great
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Really great way of explaining all the complicated SAS info.
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Dr. Desai is one of the best instructurs I've had here at Yale. He is very organized and understands how to get the relevant material in.
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Excellent. Explained complicated procedures well.
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Mayur was an excellent lecturer. He kept things engaging during long the lecture periods. Was really good at explaining new ideas in a coherent manner.
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  SUPER FRIENDLY INSTRUCTOR WITH A LOT OF EXPERTISE
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Dr Desai was very approachable and explained all the concepts well. easily the best professor I had all year!
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Excellent.
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Excellent lecturer
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  An understanding professor.
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Wonderful professor. Extremely thorough in his methods, very detail-oriented, well organized.
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  He is very good at explaining the techniques of sas
Instructor: Mayur Mahesh Desai  Professor Desai's lectures were great.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: good lab sessions

Lesley Park was helpful and good at explaining material, but it was very difficult to learn in group environment in labs, because she went a little too fast when presenting and there was not always time for her to help individually. Unreasonable in expectations of students and encouraged rote memorization rather than understanding. Although labs were stated to be collaborative on the syllabus (with only write-ups; aka summaries as individual effort), she did not show understanding of this concept. Instead of encouraging understanding, she made theexperience very stressful and inhibited learning. I have never been made to feel so judged as I was in this lab.
Trang was great! So thoughtful, intelligent and committed. I couldn't haven asked for a better TA.
TrangStrengths: Trang was very helpful and friendlyWeaknesses: Trang was not always able to solve problems that arose in the course
lesley was a good ta. i also sat in on derek's sessions which were really helpful to me. outside of the classroom, the ta's were great and willing to answer questions and be as helpful as possible.
Lesley was AMAZING and really knowledgeable.
Trang and Lesley were both amazing and helpful TAs.
Trang is lovely. Really helpful, very enthusiastic, really good at SAS!
Great TAs
Very good.
My TF, Trang, was excellent! Best I've had at Yale. Incredibly nice and very patient.

Trang was unbelievably helpful and responsive to student questions. She was patient and kind and everyone greatly appreciated her help. She had a great grasp of the concepts and did not get too picky over minute details that did not affect the answer.
Lesley was amazing... she is very knowledgeable and intelligent
My TA was Trang and as usual she is very competent and was capable of explaining anything I needed.

Trang is one of the best TAs at YSPH. She could not be nicer, more helpful, or more patient with a room full of stressed out and sometimes whiney students. She is also great at SAS and great at explaining SAS.
strengths- very helpful, approachable and friendly
very nice person and knowledgeable about course material
Trang was my best TA this semister.
Derek. he is great TA
Lesley is amazing, obviously. She makes me want to learn SAS, and it takes a lot to be a SAS inspiration cos boy is it boring!
Trang is great, patient and helpful. She should be commended.
I was fortunate to have a great TA...
Lesley was a great TA! Made SAS coding and concepts behind it easy to understand. I was very grateful to have her as a TA- I would have been lost otherwise!
Derek mccleaf--Good job, although he could stand to slow down when he teaches.
TA (Trang) was excellent and always available for additional questions, met and exceeded expectations.

Thu-Trang Thach is wonderful TA: patient, knowledgeable, caring, and always willing to help. Although the first several labs were a bit rushed, Trang quickly improved her techniques to ensure all the necessary material was covered with ample time for questions.
Lesley was fantastic. Incredibly nice, helpful, and a SAS Grand Master.
Derek did his job well

Lesley is the best TA ever. She is so knowledgeable about SAS it's ridiculous to think that she's only MPH. It makes me happy every time she gives us bonus SAS codes and neat tricks. Her nerdy SAS stories are so amusing.

I found Derek McCleaf to be an excellent TA.He was always prepared for labs and very knowledgeable when it came to addressing questions that came up from labs and the corresponding homework assignments.
Lesley Park was a very good teacher and her extra SAS hints were extremely helpful.
Trang was good but she moved to fast and then would never leave the code on the screen even after we had gone over the steps.
Lesley Park was an extremely helpful TA, and managed to teach me more about SAS than was already included in the course.
Lesley was an excellent TA. She had a thorough knowledge of SAS and was always available if we had any questions or concerns.
Trang Thach. Trang was a fantastic TA and always extremely helpful in and out of lab.
Trang Thach was an excellent TA! She truly cared about the success of the students and was always willing to answer questions and provide assistance.
Lesley ParkLesley was an excellent TA. She was very knowledgeable when it came to SAS and she was able to explain concepts very clearly.

TA: Derek McCleaf. Derek was a great TA. He went pretty fast during the labs, but was willing to go back and answer questions. He was great at including all the students in the labs and making sure we each understood the concepts.

Trang was my TA. She was absolutely excellent. She went out of her way to make sure that everyone understood the material and did well in the course. She was very personable, helpful, and prepared in lab. She returned material promptly and took a personal interest in everyone in her labs. She really went above& beyond.
Trang went above and beyond her duty as a TA. She was always available and helpful. She also provided a lot of important instruction during labs.
Trang Thach is the best TA I've ever had. She was instructive, warm, competent, engaging, encouraging, and gave prompt feedback. I have no criticisms!
She was quite helpful, but a little persnickety.
Lesley Park - absolutely wonderful.
I had Derek who was excellent. Good instructions during lab sessions and very responsive.
The TA was excellent. Extremely responsive to student needs. Always willing to help.
Derek was excellent. He helped with examples of written analysis that should follow new statistically analyses.
VERY HELPFUL TA (DEREK MCLEAF)
TA: Derek MccleafHe was okay and explained the topics as best he could. very helpful also when needed.
Trang was fantastic. She knew her material and was very interested in her students excelling.
Leslie was an ideal TA for this course, considering her experience with SAS as well as her thorough style of instructing and evaluation.
Trang was one of the best TA's I've ever had and deserves 10000 gold stars
Trang and she was the best!
the ta was okay. I think there are better ways of teaching some of the material though. at times she went to fast, but was always available to help

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great course to take!
Would not have taken it if I didn't have to.
Very good class. Covers important aspects of data analysis without going too much into the statistical details. I recommend it to all public health students.

Great course for becoming comfortable with handling data and working with SAS. Highly recommended, even if the course isn't required. I think even policy and management students should take the course.
The course is required, so just get it over with
this is a difficult class and takes up a lot of time (midterm and final) but is necessary for a career in pubic health if youare ever going to do data analysis (which most of us will!)

I would definitely recommend this class, especially for students that do not have prior SAS experience. This class is an excellent introduction to the software and gives a step by step description of the basics.

I think it is crucial that every student takes this course if they are going to be doing any sort of statistical analysis. It totally clears up all of the questions looming from Stats I.Would've been even more helpful if there were two lectures a week, just so that we would've been 100% comfortable with the material - sometimes it seemed rather rushed, especially since we cancelled three lectures, and it only meets once a week.
Take it with all your might.
I would definitely recommend this class to everyone as I feel I finally learned SAS in this class (with no prior SAS knowledge). This class is very helpful.
If you need to know how to use SAS, take this course ... and then you can you can go forward with some confidence on how to continue to build your SAS skills.
I would definitely recommend. Good intro to SAS and practical for research
Highly recommended intro to SAS.
Only take this course if you have to use SAS for thesis project or other reason.
the most useful class I have taken yet
This course is "SAS: a how-to guide"
I would recommend this course for building skills in SAS. There is a lot of overlap with Biostat and Epi, but this is the one I would keep for developing programming abilities.
I would definitely recommend this course because it is great for learning SAS.
Absolutely recommend, esp. for students w/a choice between Epi II and Data Mgt. Epi II is easier but Data Mgt is a much more useful class!
Highly recommend. Good for acquiring sas skills.Good workload. Good structure.
If you want to learn all the basics of SAS coding and data analysis, this course is ideal - definitely a must before the summer.

A Haiku:First I hated SASThen came Data ManagementNow, "Hey SAS, what's up?"True story. SAS was awful in biostats, now it's actually a lot of fun. Dr. Desai breaks everything down into simple, easy to understand steps, and teaches you a "cookbook" style of coding that really helps you keep a handle on things. Lectures are very helpful, and actually fun. The labs are a great help in practicing the skills so that when the midterm and final roll around, you're very well-prepared. One of the best, and most practical, courses I've taken at EPH.

I recommend this course. Like I previously stated, SAS is a tool which every MPH should be able to use and use well. Dr Desai makes it easy to learn because the course is structured in a 'cookbook' format.

Great course. It was challenging and SAS-centric. My favorite course by far of this first year, and Dr. Desai teaches it, and he's one of my favorite instructors at this point. You will walk away with tools/program techniques that you will see yourself using in the very near future.
Excellent course for anyone who plans to use SAS in the future. Enhances practical skills and gives you the tools to do your own research - excellent for thesis preparation.
The midterm and the final are super tough and they take forever. It is almost impossible to do well in this class.

This course teaches students to take a data set and clean it, code variables, and run statistical analysis on the data. It is by far one of the most useful classes that I have taken here at YSPH, and I would definitely recommend it to another student, especially one that may be collecting their own data for their thesis or for a summer internship.

Data Management and Analysis deals with using SAS software to organize and statistically analyze large sets of survey data. The subject matter isa bit dry, but overall it teaches useful skills applicable to, and useful for, anyone working with SAS.

This course is immensely valuable in solidifying theoretical knowledge of statistical analysis as well as building a practical skill set in SAS. This course will be useful in any career in public health.
I would recommend this course to another student because it is helpful in learning how to use SAS to perform statistical analyses.

I would definitely recommend this course to another student. I know some students have a choice between taking this course and Epi II - and personally, I think this course is more applicable to all kinds of research. Dr. Desai is an awesome instructor and the course is challenging, but very useful.

This is an excellent course in data management. you will learn SAS very well and feel confident in performing statistical analyses and constructing questionnaires in a logical and data management-friendly manner. I would definitely recommend this course, especially in preparation for summer internships.
An excellent way to become more familiar with SAS.
This class is dry and tedious at times, but it will teach you how to use SAS. The weekly labs, midterm, and final are totally reasonable--appropriately engaging and challenging but not overwhelming.
Very informative and practical but repetitive.
Yes! This class is essential to understanding SAS, and to working on thesis data.
Great course. A must take for any serious epidemiologists.
Learning how to use SAS to analyze a variety of data. Reinforces SAS skills learned in biostats.

I found this course extremely helpful in organization and the analysis of data sets provided in public health settings. The class is a real world application of the biostatistical analysis learned in other classes.
YES FOR SURE. A VERY USEFUL COURSE ESPECIALLY IF YOU ARE IN THE BIOSTATS TRACK
A must take course in YSPH! Highly recommended
Take this course. Absolutely.
Useful but a lot of work
I would definitely recommend the course.
very important and would require everyone to take it
Yes, if you are comfortable with SAS.
Absolutely! The best course I have taken at Yale!
